alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... There are some who, rather than confess their failure to understand, prefer to blame some 'emergent complexity' as soon as a problem defies analysis. Abdicating their responsibility, they find a convenient refuge in 'glorifying' this unexpected complexity, which they declare intractable on principle, instead of simply acknowledging their own deficiencies or those of their conceptual tools."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Our Descriptions of the Physical World Seem Organized in Almost Independent Layers - Part 2
